[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Pharmacy Management System (PMS) allows users to manage prescriptions, inventory, and communicate between pharmacists, doctors, and patients for safe medication.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PMS supports prescription management, inventory control, verification, alerts for low stock, and patient safety communications.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PMS integrates with healthcare and inventory systems for real-time syncing.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PMS provides web and mobile access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: PMS supports desktops, smartphones, and tablets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PMS uses secure APIs for communication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PMS sends alerts via email, SMS, and push notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PMS optimizes memory usage for efficiency.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PMS manages prescription orders, inventory tracking, and communication for clarification.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PMS supports prescription management, inventory control, verification, alerts for low stock, and patient safety communications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PMS integrates with medical records and pharmacy management tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PMS tracks prescriptions, inventory, provides real-time performance data, manages alerts, and ensures prescription accuracy via verification.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PMS serves pharmacists, healthcare providers, and patients.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PMS requires internet for syncing and notifications.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PMS relies on secure APIs, third-party integrations, and storage services.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Inventory: Medication list. Alert: Status or low stock notification. Verification: Confirm prescription accuracy.

[SEC] 2. Requirements.[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces: The system shall integrate with healthcare provider systems for prescription orders and with inventory systems for stock tracking. The system shall send updates on prescription status to healthcare providers and patients.
[SEC] 2. Requirements.[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions: The system shall track prescriptions, inventory, and communicate between pharmacists, doctors, and patients (REQ-INTF-001). The system shall generate alerts when stock is low or prescription conflicts occur (REQ-INTF-002). The system shall allow pharmacists to communicate with healthcare providers for clarification (REQ-INTF-002).
[SEC] 2. Requirements.[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements: The system shall provide an intuitive interface for all users.
[SEC] 2. Requirements.[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements: The system shall sync data in real-time without significant delay. The system shall generate alerts for low stock and prescription issues with minimal delay of detection.
[SEC] 2. Requirements.[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen: The system shall securely store prescription and inventory data with encryption.
[SEC] 2. Requirements.[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints: The system shall support cross-platform functionality and be compatible with all devices. The system shall be responsive for varying screen sizes.
[SEC] 2. Requirements.[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance: The system shall comply with HIPAA for patient data privacy and security.
[SEC] 2. Requirements.[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes: The system shall use encrypted communication for all data transfers. The system shall ensure high availability and minimize downtime.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Test integration, syncing, alerts, and verification.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, system docs, and HIPAA compliance.
[SEC] 5. References: Pharmacy practices, HIPAA compliance, and drug safety. </s>
